unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Gears Up for Accelerated 5G Rollout**
normalised: **Telecom Sector Gears Up for Accelerated 5G Rollout**

unnormalised: New Delhi, 16/11/2023 – The Indian telecommunications sector is poised for accelerated 5G deployment following a recent review meeting held at Sanchar Bhawan. Telecom operators, including Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio, have reaffirmed their commitment to expanding 5G coverage across the country.
normalised: New Delhi, sixteenth november two thousand and twenty three – The Indian telecommunications sector is poised for accelerated five G deployment following a recent review meeting held at Sanchar Bhawan. Telecom operators, including Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio, have reaffirmed their commitment to expanding five G coverage across the country.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is working closely with state governments to address right-of-way (RoW) challenges and facilitate smoother infrastructure development. Plans are in place to cover key pilgrimage routes, including Char Dham Yatra, by Q2 2024.
normalised: The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) is working closely with state governments to address right-of-way (R o W) challenges and facilitate smoother infrastructure development. Plans are in place to cover key pilgrimage routes, including Char Dham Yatra, by Q two two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: "We are committed to ensuring that 5G reaches every corner of Bharat," stated a senior DoT official.
normalised: "We are committed to ensuring that five G reaches every corner of Bharat," stated a senior D O T official.

unnormalised: Significant investment is being made to upgrade existing infrastructure and deploy new 5G-enabled towers. Initial estimates suggest investments exceeding Rs. 2.5 lakh crore. Focus is being given to covering remote areas and boosting connectivity in underserved regions.
normalised: Significant investment is being made to upgrade existing infrastructure and deploy new five G-enabled towers. Initial estimates suggest investments exceeding rupee two point five lakh crore. Focus is being given to covering remote areas and boosting connectivity in underserved regions.

unnormalised: A workshop scheduled for 22/11/2023 at 10:00 hrs will bring together industry stakeholders to discuss best practices for efficient 5G rollout. The aim is to improve network density, aiming for enhanced user experience and enabling innovative applications across sectors. Latest data suggests over 200,000 5G base stations have been installed nationwide by 01/11/2023, paving the way for the Digital India vision.
normalised: A workshop scheduled for twenty second november two thousand and twenty three at ten colon zero zero hours will bring together industry stakeholders to discuss best practices for efficient five G rollout. The aim is to improve network density, aiming for enhanced user experience and enabling innovative applications across sectors. Latest data suggests over two hundred thousand five G base stations have been installed nationwide by first november two thousand and twenty three, paving the way for the Digital India vision.
